title: Pumpkin tart in sunflower seed crust with orange cream
text:
Preheat the oven to 200°C. Grease a 35 x 13cm rectangular tart tin or a 24cm round tart tin with non-stick spray.

1. Crust: Toast the seeds in a dry pan until the colour starts to change. Remove and set aside to cool.

2. Add the flour, icing sugar and salt to the bowl of a food processor and pulse until mixed. Add the butter and pulse until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.

3. Add the seeds and water and pulse until a smooth dough starts sticking to the blade.

4. Shape the dough into a ball. Cover in clingfilm and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.

5. Line the tart tin with the dough. Prick a few holes in the bottom of the crust and bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.

6. Filling: Turn down the oven temperature to 180°C. Beat all the ingredients for the filling together and pour into the crust. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the filling has set. Set aside for 30 minutes or until cool, then carefully transfer to a wire rack and leave to cool completely.

7. Orange cream: Whip the cream until stiff peaks form and fold in the orange zest. Serve with the tart.
